name: distribution network construction, electricity, low voltage | distribution network, electricity, low voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5565/documentation

This is a copy of the swiss datasets.;This dataset describes the infrastructure (poles, cables etc.) of the electricity distribution network. It includes the medium-to-low voltage switching stations (below 2.5MVA).;The low voltage level is considered to be below 1kV, it typically supplies household and other small-scale users. Some small electricity generation installations such as photovoltaic panels feed into this voltage level.;Reference(s): René Itten, Rolf Frischknecht, Matthias Stucki, 2014, Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid

The activity includes the land and material requirements of an average km of low voltage transmission grid infrastructrure in Switzerland.

The activity ends with the disposal of the waste materials. It is assumed that 80 % of the cables are recycled.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This dataset is based on a study by Itten et. al (2014), which is based on a number of literature sources representing the years 2010 and 2011. Due to the long lifetime, as well as project planning and construction times of ectricity transmission and distribution infrastructure, the 2010 situation is considered valid at least until 2020.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average of low voltage underground cables (115'926 km) and aerial lines (12'720 km) in Switzerland in 2010 (Itten et al.2010). Switching stations use SF6.;The lifetime of the network is assumed to be 30 years (lifetime of most individual components assumed 40 years).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: No information on the material use of low voltage aerial lines was available. Therefore, the material use of low voltage cables was used for the entire lengthe of the low voltage grid.  Underground cables length  is115'926 km and aerial lines length is12'720 km on low voltage level in Switzerland in 2010

exchanges.description:
Reported as "gravel, unspecified, at mine" by Itten et al. 2014. Literature data: Bumy et al. 2010, Jones and McManus 2010 on the material use of the cable duct. According to ewz (personal communication by Itten et al. 2014)  a share of 30 % of the medium and low voltage cables is built in a cable duct made of concrete, the remainder is cable ducts are built with gravel. 
Reference(s): René Itten, Rolf Frischknecht, Matthias Stucki, 2014, Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid

exchanges.description:
Literature data; Federal office of the environment (FOEN) 2009, Swiss greenhouse gas statistics.
1% of total SF6 used in electricity transformation facilities is estimated to be emitted during construction, 1% during deconstruction, adding to 2% SF6 emitted of the total SF6 in use. 90% of SF6 in use is attributed to the high to medium votlage switch gear (considered in medium voltage network construction), 10% to the medium to low voltage switch gear (considered in low voltage network construction).

exchanges.description:
Reported as "gravel, unspecified, at mine" by Itten et al. 2014. Literature data: Bumy et al. 2010, Jones and McManus 2010 on the material use of the cable duct. According to ewz (personal communication by Itten et al. 2014)  a share of 30 % of the medium and low voltage cables is built in a cable duct made of concrete, the remainder is cable ducts are built with gravel. 
Reference(s): René Itten, Rolf Frischknecht, Matthias Stucki, 2014, Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid
